thread.title: North Korea's ceremonial leader to visit South Korea for Winter Olympics on Feb.9-11 - Seoul

title: North Korea's ceremonial leader to visit South Korea for Winter Olympics on Feb.9-11 - Seoul
text:
February 4, 2018 / 3:38 PM / Updated 9 minutes ago North Korea's ceremonial leader to visit South Korea for Winter Olympics on Feb.9-11 - Seoul Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korea’s ceremonial leader Kim Yong Nam will visit South Korea this week as the head of the country’s high-level delegation for the Winter Olympics, Seoul’s Unification Ministry said on Sunday. 
Kim, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People’s Assembly, will lead a 22-strong delegation expected to arrive in South Korea on Friday for a three-day trip, the ministry said in a statement. 
The Games are scheduled to kick off on Friday and run through Feb. 25, during which Seoul hopes to hold high-level inter-Korean talks. 
Kim is North Korea’s nominal head of state, while the country is ruled by Kim Jong Un, the third-generation hereditary leader. Reporting by Hyonhee Shin; Editing by Adrian Croft
